name.text: Open Research Conversation: Preprints across the disciplines

node.summary: Join the University of Sheffield Library for a discussion of how preprints are being adopted in different subjects and the effects of this.
Join us for a discussion about research metrics and how they can be used responsibly.

name.text: Open Research Conversation: Open Source Licensing

node.summary: Sharing software is a key part of open research, but the licensing issues presented by open source are different to those for other outputs.

name.text: Open Research Conversation: The Future of Publishing

node.summary: From Open Access to pre-registration, publishing is changing. This session asks what could scholarly publishing look like in the future?

name.text: Celebration of Open Research at The University of Sheffield

node.summary: Join us for a celebration of Open Research at the University of Sheffield with the winners of the Library's inaugural Open Research Prize.

name.text: Open Research Conversation: Sharing Qualitative Data Ethically

node.summary: This joint event with the University Research Ethics Committee will include talks and discussions about ethically sharing qualitative data.

name.text: Open Research Conversation: Electronic Lab Notebooks

node.summary: This event will include talks and discussions about the use of electronic lab notebooks in the research process and beyond.

frontmatter.title: Visualising Cultural Heritage Data
frontmatter.description: Data visualisation for cultural heritage collections workshop presented by Dr Olivia Vane of The British Library on N8 CIR Training.

frontmatter.title: Urban Observatories hackathon
frontmatter.description: The University of Sheffield hosted a three-day hackathon aimed to begin tackling the complex challenges involved in coordinating analytics using data from urban observatories across the UK.
